   20: -module(init_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([get_arguments/1, get_argument/1, boot_var/1, restart/1,
   29: 	 many_restarts/0, many_restarts/1, restart_with_mode/1,
   30: 	 get_plain_arguments/1,
   31: 	 reboot/1, stop_status/1, stop/1, get_status/1, script_id/1,
   32:          dot_erlang/1, unknown_module/1, dash_S/1, dash_extra/1,
   33:          dash_run/1, dash_s/1,
   34: 	 find_system_processes/0
   35:          ]).
   36: -export([boot1/1, boot2/1]).
   37: -export([test_dash_S/1, test_dash_s/1, test_dash_extra/0,
   38:          test_dash_run/0, test_dash_run/1]).
   39: 
   40: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   41: 
   42: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   43: %% Test suite for init. (Most code is run during system start/stop.
   44: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
   45: %% erl -sname master -rsh ctrsh
   46: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [get_arguments, get_argument, boot_var,
   53:      many_restarts, restart_with_mode,
   54:      get_plain_arguments, restart, stop_status, get_status, script_id,
   55:      dot_erlang, unknown_module, {group, boot},
   56:      dash_S, dash_extra, dash_run, dash_s].
   57: 
   58: groups() -> 
   59:     [{boot, [], [boot1, boot2]}].
   60: 
   61: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   65:     ok.
   66: 
   67: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: 
   74: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   75:     Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: get_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   81:     Args = args(),
   82:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
   83:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_arguments, []) of
   84: 	Arguments when is_list(Arguments) ->
   85: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
   86: 	    check_a(Arguments),
   87: 	    check_b(Arguments),
   88: 	    check_c(Arguments),
   89: 	    check_d(Arguments);
   90: 	_ ->
   91:             peer:stop(Peer),
   92: 	    ct:fail(get_arguments)
   93:     end,
   94:     ok.
   95: 
   96: check_a(Args) ->
   97:     case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args) of
   98: 	{value, {a,["kalle"]}} ->
   99: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(a,1,Args),
  100: 	    case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args1) of
  101: 		false ->
  102: 		    ok;
  103: 		_ ->
  104: 		    ct:fail(check_a1)
  105: 	    end;
  106: 	_ ->
  107: 	    ct:fail(check_a2)
  108:     end.
  109: 
  110: check_b(Args) ->
  111:     case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args) of
  112: 	{value, {b,["hej", "hopp"]}} ->
  113: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args),
  114: 	    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args1) of
  115: 		{value, {b,["san", "sa"]}} ->
  116: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args1),
  117: 		    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args2) of
  118: 			false ->
  119: 			    ok;
  120: 			_ ->
  121: 			    ct:fail(check_b1)
  122: 		    end;
  123: 		_ ->
  124: 		    ct:fail(check_b2)
  125: 	    end;
  126: 	_ ->
  127: 	    ct:fail(check_b3)
  128:     end.
  129: 
  130: check_c(Args) ->
  131:     case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args) of
  132: 	{value, {c,["4", "5", "6"]}} ->
  133: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args),
  134: 	    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args1) of
  135: 		{value, {c,["7", "8", "9"]}} ->
  136: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args1),
  137: 		    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args2) of
  138: 			false ->
  139: 			    ok;
  140: 			_ ->
  141: 			    ct:fail(check_c1)
  142: 		    end;
  143: 		_ ->
  144: 		    ct:fail(check_c2)
  145: 	    end;
  146: 	_ ->
  147: 	    ct:fail(check_c3)
  148:     end.
  149: 
  150: check_d(Args) ->
  151:     case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args) of
  152: 	{value, {d,[]}} ->
  153: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(d,1,Args),
  154: 	    case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args1) of
  155: 		false ->
  156: 		    ok;
  157: 		_ ->
  158: 		    ct:fail(check_d1)
  159: 	    end;
  160: 	_ ->
  161: 	    ct:fail(check_d2)
  162:     end.
  163: 
  164: get_argument(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  165:     Args = args(),
  166:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  167:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [b]) of
  168: 	{ok, [["hej", "hopp"],["san", "sa"]]} ->
  169: 	    ok;
  170: 	_ ->
  171: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  172: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, b})
  173:     end,
  174:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [a]) of
  175: 	{ok, [["kalle"]]} ->
  176: 	    ok;
  177: 	_ ->
  178: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  179: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, a})
  180:     end,
  181:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  182: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  183: 	    ok;
  184: 	_ ->
  185: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  186: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, c})
  187:     end,
  188:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [d]) of
  189: 	{ok, [[]]} ->
  190: 	    ok;
  191: 	_ ->
  192: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  193: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, d})
  194:     end,
  195:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [e]) of
  196: 	error ->
  197: 	    ok;
  198: 	_ ->
  199: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  200: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, e})
  201:     end,
  202:     peer:stop(Peer),
  203:     ok.
  204: 
  205: get_plain_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  206:     Longstring = 
  207: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  208: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  209: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  210: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  211: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  212: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  213: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  214: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  215: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2",
  216:     true = (length(Longstring) > 255),
  217:     Args = long_args(Longstring),
  218:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  219:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_plain_arguments, []) of
  220: 	["a", "b", "c", Longstring] ->
  221: 	    ok;
  222: 	As ->
  223: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  224: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, As})
  225:     end,
  226:     peer:stop(Peer),
  227: 
  228:     ok.
  229: 
  230: 
  231: %% ------------------------------------------------
  232: %% Use -boot_var flag to set $TEST_VAR in boot script.
  233: %% ------------------------------------------------
  234: boot_var(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     {BootScript, TEST_VAR, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} = create_boot(Config),
  236: 
  237:     %% Should fail as we have not given -boot_var TEST_VAR
  238:     try
  239:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-boot", BootScript], connection => standard_io}),
  240:         ct:fail({boot_var, "Should not start without TEST_VAR"})
  241:     catch
  242:         exit:{boot_failed,{exit_status,1}} ->
  243:             ok
  244:     end,
  245: 
  246: 
  247:     case is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) of
  248: 	true ->
  249: 	    %% Now it should work !!
  250: 	    {ok, Peer, _} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootScript, "-boot_var", "TEST_VAR", TEST_VAR]),
  251: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  252: 	    Res = ok;
  253: 	_ ->
  254: 	    %% What we need is not so much version numbers on the directories, but
  255: 	    %% for the boot var TEST_VAR to appear in the boot script, and it doesn't
  256: 	    %% if we give the 'local' option to systools:make_script.
  257: 	    io:format(
  258: 	      "Test case not complete as we are not~n"
  259: 	      "running in a real system!~n"
  260: 	      "Probably this test is performed in a "
  261: 	      "clearcase view or source tree.~n"
  262: 	      "Need version numbers on the kernel and "
  263: 	      "stdlib directories!~n",
  264: 	      []),
  265: 	    Res = {skip,
  266: 		   "Test case only partially run since it is run "
  267: 		   "in a clearcase view or in a source tree. "
  268: 		   "Need an installed system to complete this test."}
  269:     end,
  270:     Res.
  271: 
  272: create_boot(Config) ->
  273:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  274:     {LatestDir, LatestName, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} =
  275: 	create_script(Config),
  276:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  277:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
  278:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName,
  279: 			      [{variables, [{"TEST_VAR", LibDir}]}]),
  280:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
  281:     {LatestDir ++ "/" ++ LatestName, LibDir, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn}.
  282: 
  283: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
  284:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  285:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "kernel-"++KernelVsn)) andalso
  286: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "stdlib-"++StdlibVsn)).
  287: 
  288: %% ------------------------------------------------
  289: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  290: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  291: %% before restart.
  292: %% ------------------------------------------------
  293: many_restarts() ->
  294:     [{timetrap,{minutes,16}}].
  295: 
  296: many_restarts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  297:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io}),
  298:     loop_restart(50,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])),
  299:     peer:stop(Peer),
  300:     ok.
  301: 
  302: loop_restart(0,_,_,_) ->
  303:     ok;
  304: loop_restart(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  305:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  306:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  307:     receive
  308: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  309: 	    ok
  310:     after 10000 ->
  311: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  312: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  313:     end,
  314:     ok = wait_for(60, Peer, Node, EHPid),
  315:     loop_restart(N-1,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])).
  316: 
  317: wait_for(0,Peer,_Node,_) ->
  318:     peer:stop(Peer),
  319:     error;
  320: wait_for(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  321:     case rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [logger]) of
  322: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid), Pid =/= EHPid ->
  323: 	    %% erlang:display(ok),
  324: 	    ok;
  325: 	_X ->
  326: 	    %% erlang:display(_X),
  327: 	    %% Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  328: 	    %% erlang:display(Procs),
  329: 	    %% case is_list(Procs) of
  330: 	    %%     true ->
  331: 	    %% 	  [(catch erlang:display(
  332: 	    %% 			  rpc:call(Node,
  333: 	    %% 				   erlang,
  334: 	    %% 				   process_info,
  335: 	    %% 				   [Y,registered_name])))
  336: 	    %% 		 || Y <- Procs];
  337: 	    %%     _ ->
  338: 	    %% 	  ok
  339: 	    %% end,
  340: 	    receive
  341: 	    after 100 ->
  342: 		    ok
  343: 	    end,
  344: 	    wait_for(N-1,Peer,Node,EHPid)
  345:     end.
  346: 
  347: restart_with_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  348:     %% We cannot use loose_node because it doesn't run in
  349:     %% embedded mode so we quickly start one that exits after restarting
  350:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  351: 
  352:     Quote = case os:type() of
  353:                 {win32,_} ->
  354:                     [$"];
  355:                 {unix,_} ->
  356:                     [$']
  357:             end,
  358: 
  359:     Eval1 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of interactive -> init:restart([{mode,embedded}]); embedded -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  360:     Cmd1 = Erl ++ " -mode interactive -noshell -eval " ++ Eval1,
  361:     "interactiveembedded" = os:cmd(Cmd1),
  362: 
  363:     Eval2 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of embedded -> init:restart([{mode,interactive}]); interactive -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  364:     Cmd2 = Erl ++ " -mode embedded -noshell -eval " ++ Eval2,
  365:     "embeddedinteractive" = os:cmd(Cmd2),
  366: 
  367:     ok.
  368: 
  369: %% ------------------------------------------------
  370: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  371: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  372: %% before restart.
  373: %% ------------------------------------------------
  374: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     Args = args(),
  376:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args, connection => standard_io}),
  377:     %% Ok, the node is up, now the real test test begins.
  378:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  379:     SysProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  380:     io:format("SysProcs0=~p~n", [SysProcs0]),
  381:     [InitPid, PurgerPid, LitCollectorPid,
  382:      DirtySigNPid, DirtySigHPid, DirtySigMPid,
  383:      PrimFilePid,
  384:      ESockRegPid] = SysProcs0,
  385:     InitPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  386:     PurgerPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  387:     Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  388:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  389:     MaxPid = lists:last(Procs),
  390:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  391:     receive
  392: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  393: 	    ok
  394:     after 10000 ->
  395: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  396: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  397:     end,
  398:     ok = wait_restart(30, Node),
  399: 
  400:     SysProcs1 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  401:     io:format("SysProcs1=~p~n", [SysProcs1]),
  402:     [InitPid1, PurgerPid1, LitCollectorPid1,
  403:      DirtySigNPid1, DirtySigHPid1, DirtySigMPid1,
  404:      PrimFilePid1,
  405:      ESockRegPid1] = SysProcs1,
  406: 
  407:     %% Still the same init process!
  408:     InitPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  409:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid),
  410:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid1),
  411: 
  412:     %% and same purger process!
  413:     PurgerPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  414:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid),
  415:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid1),
  416: 
  417:     %% and same literal area collector process!
  418:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid),
  419:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid1),
  420: 
  421:     %% and same normal dirty signal handler process!
  422:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid),
  423:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid1),
  424:     %% and same high dirty signal handler process!
  425:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid),
  426:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid1),
  427:     %% and same max dirty signal handler process!
  428:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid),
  429:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid1),
  430: 
  431:     %% and same prim_file helper process!
  432:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid),
  433:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid1),
  434: 
  435:     %% and same socket_registry helper process!
  436:     if ESockRegPid =:= undefined, ESockRegPid1 =:= undefined ->
  437:             %% No socket registry on either node
  438:             ok;
  439:        true ->
  440:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid),
  441:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid1)
  442:     end,
  443: 
  444:     NewProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  445:     NewProcs = NewProcs0 -- SysProcs1,
  446:     case check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) of
  447: 	true ->
  448: 	    ok;
  449: 	_ ->
  450: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  451: 	    ct:fail(processes_not_greater)
  452:     end,
  453: 
  454:     %% Check that socket tables has been re-initialized; check one
  455:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  456: 
  457:     %% Test that, for instance, the same argument still exists.
  458:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  459: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  460: 	    ok;
  461: 	_ ->
  462: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  463: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, restart_fail})
  464:     end,
  465:     peer:stop(Peer),
  466:     ok.
  467: 
  468: -record(sys_procs, {init,
  469: 		    code_purger,
  470: 		    literal_collector,
  471: 		    dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  472: 		    dirty_sig_handler_high,
  473: 		    dirty_sig_handler_max,
  474:                     prim_file,
  475:                     socket_registry}).
  476: 
  477: find_system_processes() ->
  478:     find_system_procs(processes(), #sys_procs{}).
  479: 
  480: find_system_procs([], SysProcs) ->
  481:     [SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  482:      SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  483:      SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  484:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  485:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  486:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  487:      SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  488:      SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry];
  489: find_system_procs([P|Ps], SysProcs) ->
  490:     case process_info(P, [initial_call, priority]) of
  491: 	[{initial_call,{erl_init,start,2}},_] ->
  492: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  493: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{init = P});
  494: 	[{initial_call,{erts_code_purger,start,0}},_] ->
  495: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  496: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{code_purger = P});
  497: 	[{initial_call,{erts_literal_area_collector,start,0}},_] ->
  498: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  499: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{literal_collector = P});
  500: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  501:          {priority,normal}] ->
  502: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  503: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_normal = P});
  504: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  505:                        {priority,high}] ->
  506: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  507: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_high = P});
  508: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  509:          {priority,max}] ->
  510: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  511: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_max = P});
  512:         [{initial_call,{prim_file,start,0}},_] ->
  513: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  514: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{prim_file = P});
  515:         [{initial_call,{socket_registry,start,0}},_] ->
  516: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry,
  517: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{socket_registry = P});
  518: 	_ ->
  519: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs)
  520:     end.
  521: 
  522: wait_restart(0, _Node) ->
  523:     ct:fail(not_restarted);
  524: wait_restart(N, Node) ->
  525:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  526: 	pong -> ok;
  527: 	_ -> 
  528: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
  529: 	    wait_restart(N - 1, Node)
  530:     end.
  531: 
  532: check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) ->
  533:     [N,P,I] = apid(MaxPid),
  534:     case lists:filter(fun(Pid) ->
  535: 			      case apid(Pid) of
  536: 				  [N,P1,_I1] when P1 > P -> false;
  537: 				  [N,_P1,I1] when I1 > I -> false;
  538: 				  _                      -> true
  539: 			      end
  540: 		      end, NewProcs) of
  541: 	[] ->
  542: 	    true;
  543: 	_  ->
  544: 	    false
  545:     end.
  546: 
  547: apid(Pid) ->
  548:     [N,P,I] = string:tokens(pid_to_list(Pid),"<>."),
  549:     [list_to_integer(N),list_to_integer(P),list_to_integer(I)].
  550: 
  551: fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node) ->
  552:     case code:is_loaded(prim_socket) of
  553:         {file,preloaded} ->
  554:             lists:sort(rpc:call(Node, socket, supports, [msg_flags]));
  555:         _ ->
  556:             ok
  557:     end.
  558: 
  559: %% ------------------------------------------------
  560: %% Just test that the system is halted here.
  561: %% The reboot facility using heart is tested
  562: %% in the heart_SUITE.
  563: %% ------------------------------------------------
  564: reboot(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  565:     Args = args(),
  566:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  567:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  568:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  569:     receive
  570: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  571: 	    ok
  572:     after 10000 ->
  573: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  574: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  575:     end,
  576:     ct:sleep(5000),
  577:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  578: 	pang ->
  579: 	    ok;
  580: 	_ ->
  581: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  582: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  583:     end,
  584:     ok.
  585: 
  586: %% ------------------------------------------------
  587: %%
  588: %% ------------------------------------------------
  589: stop_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  590:     badarg = catch_stop([65,[66],67]),  % flat strings only
  591:     badarg = catch_stop([65, 666, 67]),  % only bytes in string
  592:     badarg = catch_stop(abort),  % 'abort' not allowed
  593:     badarg = catch_stop(true),  % other atoms not allowed
  594:     badarg = catch_stop(-1),  % no negative statuses
  595:     ok.
  596: 
  597: catch_stop(Status) ->
  598:     try init:stop(Status) catch error:badarg -> badarg end.
  599: 
  600: %% ------------------------------------------------
  601: %%
  602: %% ------------------------------------------------
  603: stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  604:     Args = args(),
  605:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  606:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  607:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  608:     receive
  609: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  610: 	    ok
  611:     after 10000 ->
  612: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  613: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  614:     end,
  615:     ct:sleep(5000),
  616:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  617: 	pang ->
  618: 	    ok;
  619: 	_ ->
  620: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  621: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  622:     end,
  623:     ok.
  624: 
  625: %% ------------------------------------------------
  626: %% 
  627: %% ------------------------------------------------
  628: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  629:     {Start, _} = init:get_status(),
  630: 
  631:     %% Depending on how the test_server is started Start has
  632:     %% different values. staring if test_server started with
  633:     %% -s flag.
  634:     case lists:member(Start, [started, starting]) of
  635: 	true ->
  636: 	    ok;
  637: 	_ ->
  638: 	    ct:fail(get_status)
  639:     end.
  640: 
  641: %% ------------------------------------------------
  642: %% 
  643: %% ------------------------------------------------
  644: script_id(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  645:     {Name, Vsn} = init:script_id(),
  646:     if
  647: 	is_list(Name), is_list(Vsn) ->
  648: 	    ok;
  649: 	true ->
  650: 	    ct:fail(not_standard_script)
  651:     end,
  652:     ok.
  653: 
  654: %% ------------------------------------------------
  655: %% Test that .erlang file works as it should
  656: %% ------------------------------------------------
  657: dot_erlang(Config) ->
  658:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  659: 
  660:     TestHome = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  661:     ok = file:make_dir(TestHome),
  662: 
  663:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  664:                   {win32, _} ->
  665:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  666:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  667:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  668:                   _ ->
  669:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  670:               end,
  671: 
  672:     NodeOpts = #{ env => HomeEnv },
  673: 
  674:     %% Get basedir of peer node
  675:     {ok, CreatorPeer, CreatorNode} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  676:     UserConfig = erpc:call(CreatorNode, filename, basedir, [user_config,"erlang"]),
  677:     peer:stop(CreatorPeer),
  678: 
  679:     XDGErlang = filename:join([UserConfig, ".erlang"]),
  680:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(XDGErlang),
  681:     ok = file:write_file(XDGErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,xdg)."),
  682: 
  683:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  684: 
  685:     ?assertEqual({ok, xdg}, erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  686:     peer:stop(Peer),
  687: 
  688:     HomeErlang = filename:join([TestHome, ".erlang"]),
  689:     ok = file:write_file(HomeErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,home)."),
  690:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  691: 
  692:     ?assertEqual({ok, home}, erpc:call(Node2, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  693:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  694: 
  695:     ok.
  696: 
  697: unknown_module(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  698:     Port = open_port({spawn, "erl -s unknown_module"},
  699:                      [exit_status, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  700:     Error = "Error! Failed to load module 'unknown_module' because it cannot be found.",
  701:     [_ | _] = string:find(collect_until_exit_one(Port), Error),
  702:     ok.
  703: 
  704: collect_until_exit_one(Port) ->
  705:     receive
  706:         {Port, {data, Msg}} -> Msg ++ collect_until_exit_one(Port);
  707:         {Port, {exit_status, 1}} -> []
  708:     after
  709:         30_000 -> ct:fail(erl_timeout)
  710:     end.
  711: 
  712: %% ------------------------------------------------
  713: %% Start the slave system with -boot flag.
  714: %% ------------------------------------------------
  715: 
  716: boot1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  717:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", "start_sasl"],
  718:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  719:     peer:stop(Peer),
  720: 
  721:     %% Try to start with non existing boot file.
  722:     Args1 = args() ++ ["-boot", "dummy_script"],
  723:     try
  724:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args1, connection => standard_io}),
  725:         ct:fail({boot1, "started with non existing boot file"})
  726:     catch
  727:         exit:{boot_failed, {exit_status, 1}} ->
  728:             ok
  729:     end.
  730: 
  731: boot2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  732:     %% Absolute boot file name
  733:     Boot = filename:join([code:root_dir(), "bin", "start_sasl"]),
  734: 
  735:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", Boot],
  736:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  737:     peer:stop(Peer),
  738: 
  739:     case os:type() of 
  740: 	{win32, _} ->
  741: 	    %% Absolute boot file name for Windows -- all slashes are
  742: 	    %% converted to backslashes.
  743: 	    Win_boot = lists:map(fun
  744: 				     ($/) -> $\\;
  745: 				     (C) -> C
  746: 				end, Boot),
  747: 	    Args2 = args() ++ ["-boot", Win_boot],
  748: 	    {ok, Peer2, _Node2} = ?CT_PEER(Args2),
  749: 	    peer:stop(Peer2);
  750: 	_ ->
  751: 	    ok
  752:     end,
  753: 
  754:     ok.
  755: 
  756: dash_S(_Config) ->
  757: 
  758:     %% Test that arguments are passed correctly
  759:     {[],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test([]),
  760:     {["a"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["a"]),
  761:     {["-S","--"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-S","--"]),
  762:     {["--help"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["--help"]),
  763:     {["-extra"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-extra"]),
  764:     {["-run"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-run"]),
  765:     {["-args_file"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-args_file"]),
  766:     {["+A","-1"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["+A","-1"]),
  767:     {["-s","init","stop"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-s","init","stop"]),
  768: 
  769:     %% Test that environment variables are handled correctly
  770:     {["a"],["b","c","d"],[]} =
  771:         run_dash_S_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","b"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],["a"]),
  772:     %% test that -S in environment variables are interpreted as flags
  773:     {["a"],[],[["a"],["b"],["c"]]} =
  774:         run_dash_S_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","+S 1 -S a"},{"ERL_FLAGS","-S b"},
  775:                          {"ERL_ZFLAGS","-S c"}],["a"]),
  776: 
  777:     %% Test that -s and -run work
  778:     ?assertMatch(
  779:        "[a].{[\"a\""++_,
  780:        run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_s","a","-S",?MODULE,"test_dash_S","a"])),
  781:     ?assertMatch(
  782:        "[\"a\"].{[\"a\""++_,
  783:        run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_s","a","-S",?MODULE,"test_dash_S","a"])),
  784: 
  785:     %% Test error conditions
  786:     ?assertNotEqual(
  787:        nomatch,
  788:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S"]),
  789:                    "Error! The -S option must be followed by at least a module to start")),
  790: 
  791:     ?assertNotEqual(
  792:        nomatch,
  793:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S","a"]),
  794:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  795: 
  796:     ?assertNotEqual(
  797:        nomatch,
  798:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S",?MODULE,"a"]),
  799:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/1 is not exported.")),
  800: 
  801:     ok.
  802: 
  803: run_dash_S_test(Args) ->
  804:     run_dash_S_test("", Args).
  805: run_dash_S_test(Prefix, Args) ->
  806:     run_dash_test(Prefix, ["-S", ?MODULE, "test_dash_S" | Args]).
  807: 
  808: test_dash_S(Args) ->
  809:     AllArgs = {Args, init:get_plain_arguments(),
  810:                proplists:get_all_values('S',init:get_arguments()),
  811:                erlang:system_info(emu_args)},
  812:     io:format("~p.",[AllArgs]),
  813:     erlang:halt().
  814: 
  815: test_dash_s(Args) ->
  816:     io:format("~p.",[Args]).
  817: 
  818: dash_run(_Config) ->
  819: 
  820:     {undefined,[]} =
  821:         run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","-s","init","stop"]),
  822: 
  823:     {["a"],["b"]} =
  824:         run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","a","--","b","-s","init","stop"]),
  825: 
  826:     %% Test error conditions
  827:     ?assertNotEqual(
  828:        nomatch,
  829:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run","a"]),
  830:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  831: 
  832:     ?assertNotEqual(
  833:        nomatch,
  834:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE]),
  835:                    "Error! init_SUITE:start/0 is not exported.")),
  836: 
  837:     ?assertNotEqual(
  838:        nomatch,
  839:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"a"]),
  840:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/0 is not exported.")),
  841: 
  842:     ok.
  843: 
  844: test_dash_run() ->
  845:     test_dash_run(undefined).
  846: test_dash_run(Args) ->
  847:     io:format("~p.",[{Args, init:get_plain_arguments(), erlang:system_info(emu_args)}]),
  848:     ok.
  849: 
  850: dash_s(_Config) ->
  851: 
  852:     {undefined,[]} =
  853:         run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","-s","init","stop"]),
  854: 
  855:     {[a],["b"]} =
  856:         run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","a","--","b","-s","init","stop"]),
  857: 
  858:     %% Test error conditions
  859:     ?assertNotEqual(
  860:        nomatch,
  861:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s","a"]),
  862:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  863: 
  864:     ?assertNotEqual(
  865:        nomatch,
  866:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE]),
  867:                    "Error! init_SUITE:start/0 is not exported.")),
  868: 
  869:     ?assertNotEqual(
  870:        nomatch,
  871:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"a"]),
  872:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/0 is not exported.")),
  873: 
  874:     ok.
  875: 
  876: dash_extra(Config) ->
  877:     %% Test that arguments are passed correctly
  878:     {[]} = run_dash_extra_test([]),
  879:     {["a"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["a"]),
  880:     {["--help"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["--help"]),
  881:     {["-S","--"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-S","--"]),
  882:     {["-extra","--"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-extra","--"]),
  883:     {["-run"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-run"]),
  884:     {["-args_file"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-args_file"]),
  885:     {["+A","-1"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["+A","-1"]),
  886:     {["-s","init","stop"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-s","init","stop"]),
  887: 
  888:     %% Test that environment variables are handled correctly
  889:     {["b","c","d","a"]} =
  890:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","b"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],
  891:                             ["a"]),
  892:     {["c","d","+A","1","--","a"]} =
  893:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","-extra +A 1 --"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],
  894:                             ["a"]),
  895:     {["+A","a","+B","+C"]} =
  896:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","-extra +A"},
  897:                              {"ERL_FLAGS","-extra +B"},
  898:                              {"ERL_ZFLAGS","-extra +C"}],["a"]),
  899: 
  900:     %% Test that arguments from -args_file work as they should
  901:     ArgsFile = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config),
  902:                              atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_args_file.args"),
  903:     NestedArgsFile = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config),
  904:                              atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_nexted_args_file.args"),
  905:     file:write_file(NestedArgsFile,"y -extra +Y"),
  906: 
  907:     file:write_file(ArgsFile,["z -args_file ",NestedArgsFile," -extra +Z"]),
  908: 
  909:     {["c","z","y","d",
  910:       %% -extra starts here
  911:       "a","+Y","+Z","b"]} =
  912:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_FLAGS",["c -args_file ",ArgsFile," d -extra b"]}],["a"]),
  913: 
  914:     ok.
  915: 
  916: run_dash_extra_test(Args) ->
  917:     run_dash_extra_test([], Args).
  918: run_dash_extra_test(Prefix, Args) ->
  919:     run_dash_test(Prefix, ["-run", ?MODULE, "test_dash_extra", "-extra" | Args]).
  920: 
  921: test_dash_extra() ->
  922:     AllArgs = {init:get_plain_arguments(), erlang:system_info(emu_args)},
  923:     io:format("~p.",[AllArgs]),
  924:     erlang:halt().
  925: 
  926: 
  927: run_dash_test(Args) ->
  928:     run_dash_test([],Args).
  929: run_dash_test(Env, Args) ->
  930:     [Exec | ExecArgs] = string:split(ct:get_progname()," ", all),
  931:     PortExec = os:find_executable(Exec),
  932:     PortArgs = ExecArgs ++ ["-pa",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  933:                             "-noshell" | Args],
  934:     PortEnv = [{"ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS","0"} |
  935:                [{K,lists:flatten(V)} || {K, V} <- Env]],
  936:     ct:log("Exec: ~p~nPortArgs: ~p~nPortEnv: ~p~n",[PortExec, PortArgs, PortEnv]),
  937:     Port =
  938:         open_port({spawn_executable, PortExec},
  939:                   [stderr_to_stdout,binary,out,in,hide,exit_status,
  940:                    {args, PortArgs}, {env, PortEnv}]),
  941:     receive
  942:         {Port,{exit_status,N}} ->
  943:             N
  944:     after 5000 ->
  945:             ct:fail({timeout, receive M -> M after 0 -> [] end})
  946:     end,
  947:     Res = unicode:characters_to_list(
  948:             iolist_to_binary(
  949:               (fun F() ->
  950:                        receive
  951:                            {Port,{data,Data}} ->
  952:                                [Data | F()]
  953:                        after 0 ->
  954:                                []
  955:                        end
  956:                end)())),
  957:     ct:log("Res: ~ts~n",[Res]),
  958:     maybe
  959:         {ok, Toks, _} ?= erl_scan:string(Res),
  960:         {ok, Tuple} ?= erl_parse:parse_term(Toks),
  961:         erlang:delete_element(tuple_size(Tuple), Tuple)
  962:     else
  963:         _ ->
  964:             Res
  965:     end.
  966: 
  967: %% Misc. functions    
  968: 
  969: args() ->
  970:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp",
  971:         "--", "c", "d", "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  972: 
  973: long_args(A) ->
  974:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp", "--", "c", A,
  975:         "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  976: 
  977: create_script(Config) ->
  978:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  979:     Name = PrivDir ++ "boot_var_test",
  980:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
  981:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
  982:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
  983:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
  984:     io:format(Fd,
  985: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
  986: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
  987: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
  988: 	      [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
  989:     file:close(Fd),
  990:     {filename:dirname(Name), filename:basename(Name),
  991:      KernelVer, StdlibVer}.
  992:
